name: Xignite-typeahead
tagline: A client side plugin for XigniteSearch
body:
### Getting Started
1. Get the js and css files from [https://github.com/Xignite/xignite-typeahead](https://github.com/Xignite/xignite-typeahead).

2. Get the dependencies (jQuery 1.x is recommended if you intend to support IE 6-8):

* [jQuery](http://jquery.com/download/)
* [jQueryUI](http://jqueryui.com/download/)

3. Create an arbitrary input element in your HTML.  The **data-xignite-typeahead-key** is used as an optional way to provide a contextual parameter value to the API.  It must be specified if a **keyParam** (in step 4) is defined.  In our case, the keyParam field **is** required for our API, in this case XigniteSearch...so we will just set it:

```
<input type="text" class="xignite-typeahead" data-xignite-typeahead-key="XigniteGlobalQuotes.GetGlobalDelayedQuote.Identifier" />
```

4. Invoke the widget in javascript like so:

```
<script type="text/javascript">
	$(".xignite-typeahead").xigniteTypeahead({ api: "http://search.xignite.com/Search/Suggest", keyParam: "parameter", q: "term" });
</script>
```

### Live Example
See [http://xignite-github-typeahead.s3.amazonaws.com/example.html](http://xignite-github-typeahead.s3.amazonaws.com/example.html) for a complete example.

### More on XigniteSearch
For more info on the XigniteSearch API, see [Xignite Labs](http://www.xignite.com/labs/typeahead).
